headline.main: ALLIES BOMB BASES FEEDING SALAMAUA; Smash 75 Enemy Planes at Wewak, Madang and Babo and Buin in Solomons

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN THE SOUTHWEST PACIFIC, Wednesday, Sept. 1 (U.P.) -- Allied air fleets, blocking Japanese aerial and sea support to beleaguered garrisons in the Southwest Pacific, have destroyed or damage seventy-five enemy planes, thirty barges and two ships, including a cruiser, while jungle troops crushed Japanese suicide counter-attacks to tighten their grip on the approaches to Salamaua, New Guinea, official reports said today.
